alert.note: Alert for Centre; Clinton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 2:25AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Centre, Clinton, Lycoming, Mifflin, Snyder, Sullivan and Union. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 225 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Williamsport, Montoursville, Carroll, Woodward, Muncy, Hughesville, Burnham, Montgomery, Milroy, Duboistown, New Columbia, McClure, Millheim, Aaronsburg, Rebersburg, Allenwood, Coburn, Troxelville, Madisonburg and Alfarata. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
